content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs the system, I successfully wrote the new features of Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye) to the file "/home/atlas/release-notes.txt" using the "write_to_file" command, and then executed the "read_file" command with the filename argument to retrieve the contents of the file. My computer returned that the new features include over 11,294 new packages and updates to over 72% of the software packages in the distribution, with support for various architectures and desktop environments. Other new features include driverless scanning and printing, a new generic open command, control groups v2, a persistent systemd journal, a new Fcitx 5 Input Method, improved man page translations, improved support for alternative init systems, and kernel support for exFAT. The Debian Med team has also added new packages in the field of life sciences and medicine, with more existing packages gaining Continuous Integration support. I then received a command to Google "How to use new features in Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)" from the user.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'your computer', 'content': 'Command google returned: ["https://www.debian.org/News/2021/20210814", "https://9to5linux.com/debian-gnu-linux-11-bullseye-officially-released-this-is-whats-new", "https://www.debian.org/releases/stable/i386/release-notes/ch-whats-new.html", "https://wiki.debian.org/DebianBullseye", "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Debian_version_history", "https://tecadmin.net/debian-11-features/", "https://www.mgt-commerce.com/blog/debian-11-bullseye/", "https://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/update-upgrade-debian-10-to-debian-11-bullseye/"]'}]
